title: DOB Safety Violations
ufd: This dataset contains information on safety violations issued by the NYC Department of Buildings (DOB) that are payable in DOB NOW. It includes details about the violation, such as the issue date, type, and status, as well as the location of the violation, including borough, block, lot, house number, street, city, state, and zip code. A key column is `violation_remarks`, which describes the specific reason for the violation, such as failure to file required inspections. The `violation_type` column categorizes the violation as either HBLVIO or LBLVIO, potentially indicating high or low-pressure boiler violations. The `violation_status` column indicates whether the violation is active. This dataset could be used to analyze trends in safety violations across different boroughs or to identify properties with recurring violations. It can also be used to understand the types of safety violations that are most common in the city.
sfd:
Dataset Overview:

Location data is also provided, including borough, block, lot, and address details.

title: Street Hail Livery (SHL) Permits
ufd: This dataset contains information on active Street Hail Livery (SHL) permits authorized by the NYC Taxi and Limousine Commission (TLC). Each row represents a unique permit, identified by its license number, and includes details about the licensee, such as their name and the license type. The dataset also provides information on the vehicle associated with the permit, including the DMV license plate number, VIN, and vehicle year. Key columns include 'active', indicating whether the permit is currently valid, 'license_status', 'suspension_reason', and the 'date_updated' and 'time_updated' fields, which show when the data was last refreshed. Researchers, transportation analysts, and the general public can use this dataset to understand the current landscape of SHL permits in NYC, track permit status, and analyze trends in vehicle types and associated bases. The dataset also includes contact information of the base, such as name, telephone number, address and website.

title: DOB NOW: Electrical Permit Applications
ufd: This dataset contains information on electrical permit applications filed with the New York City Department of Buildings (DOB). It includes details about the job, such as the job filing number, address (house number, street name, borough, and zip code), and job status. The dataset also provides information on the applicant, including license type and number, firm name, and contact information. Key dates include the filing date, job start date, and completion date. You can use this data to track electrical work being performed in the city, analyze trends in electrical permit applications, or examine the distribution of work across different boroughs. The dataset also includes information on insurance policies related to the electrical work, such as general liability and worker's compensation.

title: DOF Parking Violation Codes
ufd: This dataset provides a comprehensive list of parking violation codes in New York City, along with their corresponding fine amounts. Each entry includes a unique code and a clear definition of the violation, such as "FAILURE TO DISPLAY BUS PERMIT" or "BUS LANE VIOLATION." The fine amounts are broken down by location: "manhattan_96th_st_below" and "all_other_areas," with each fine including a $15 New York State Criminal Justice surcharge. Researchers, urban planners, and transportation enthusiasts can use this data to analyze parking violation patterns, understand the cost associated with different violations, and potentially inform policy decisions related to traffic management and parking enforcement. The dataset contains 97 unique violation codes and their associated fine amounts for different areas of the city.
sfd:

title: Medallion Vehicles - Inactive
ufd: This dataset provides information on inactive medallion vehicles, offering insights into the status and reasons for their inactivity. Key columns include the license number, the name of the licensee, the date of the license, and the current status of the medallion. The dataset also specifies the DMV license plate number, vehicle identification number (VIN), vehicle type (e.g., HYB, WAV, BEV), and the model year of the vehicle. Furthermore, it details the medallion type (either "Named Driver" or "Owner Must Drive"), the agent number, suspension date, and the reason for suspension. This data can be used to analyze trends in medallion vehicle inactivity, understand the common reasons for suspension, and track vehicle characteristics associated with inactive medallions. The dataset is updated daily and includes the last updated date and time for accuracy.
sfd:

title: SARS-CoV-2 concentrations measured in NYC Wastewater
ufd: This dataset contains information about SARS-CoV-2 N gene levels in New York City's Wastewater Resource Recovery Facilities (WRRF). It includes data disaggregated by WRRF, sample collection date, and test date. Key columns include `wrrf_name` (the name of the wastewater treatment plant), `sample_date` and `test_date` (the dates of sample collection and testing), `population_served` (the population served by the WRRF), and `copies_l` (SARS-CoV-2 concentration). The `technology` column specifies the type of digital PCR used for the analysis. Note that the RT-qPCR was changed to digital PCR in April 2023, resulting in values that are about 10-20 times higher than those of RT-qPCR. Researchers and public health officials can use this data to track trends in SARS-CoV-2 concentrations in NYC WRRF influent.
sfd:
**Dataset Overview:**
This dataset provides SARS-CoV-2 N gene concentration levels detected in influent wastewater samples collected from New York City's Wastewater Resource Recovery Facilities (WRRFs). The data is organized by WRRF, sample date, and test date, and includes information on the population served by each facility. The dataset also specifies the digital PCR technology used for analysis, noting a change from RT-qPCR in April 2023 that resulted in higher concentration values.

**Related Topics:**
- Wastewater Surveillance
- SARS-CoV-2
- Public Health
- Epidemiology
- Viral Load
- Environmental Monitoring
- New York City

**Concepts and Synonyms:**
- SARS-CoV-2 N gene: Coronavirus nucleocapsid gene, COVID-19 marker
- Wastewater Resource Recovery Facility (WRRF): Wastewater treatment plant, sewage treatment plant
- Copies/L (copies_l): Viral concentration, viral load, gene copies per liter
- Sample Date: Collection date, date of sample
- Test Date: Analysis date, date of testing
- Digital PCR: dPCR, Polymerase Chain Reaction
- RT-qPCR: Reverse transcription quantitative PCR, Real-time PCR

**Applications and Use Cases:**
- Tracking trends in SARS-CoV-2 prevalence in NYC communities.
- Monitoring the effectiveness of public health interventions.
- Predicting potential surges in COVID-19 cases.
- Comparing viral loads across different WRRFs and neighborhoods.
- Assessing the impact of new variants on wastewater concentrations.
- Evaluating the performance of different PCR technologies for wastewater surveillance.

title: Electronics Drop Off Locations in NYC
ufd: This dataset provides a comprehensive list of electronics drop-off locations across New York City, essential for residents looking to responsibly dispose of unwanted electronic devices in compliance with New York State law. The dataset includes key details such as the borough, neighborhood (ntaname), and name of the drop-off site (dropoff_sitename), along with the address and zip code for easy navigation. You can use this dataset to find the nearest and most convenient electronics recycling location. Additionally, the dataset incorporates geographic information like community district, census tract, council district, and other political districts, enabling analysis of recycling accessibility across different areas. The inclusion of latitude and longitude coordinates allows for mapping and spatial analysis of drop-off locations. This dataset can be valuable for city planners, environmental organizations, and residents interested in promoting responsible e-waste disposal and understanding resource distribution.
sfd:

title: Census Demographics at the Neighborhood Tabulation Area (NTA) level
ufd: This dataset provides a detailed look at population changes in New York City at the neighborhood level between the years 2000 and 2010. It includes demographic information aggregated to Neighborhood Tabulation Areas (NTAs), which are groupings of census tracts within the city. Key columns include the borough and NTA name, allowing users to analyze population trends in specific geographic areas. The dataset also contains the FIPS county code for each area. Population figures are provided for both 2000 and 2010, along with the numerical and percentage change over that decade. Researchers, city planners, and community organizations can use this data to understand population shifts, identify areas of growth or decline, and inform policy decisions. The data spans across the Bronx, Brooklyn, and Manhattan boroughs.
